Vythica-Floshin.name: Vythica Floshin
Vythica-Floshin.quote: "It's been quite a while since I had a visitor. Please, come in. We can have some tea and chat."
description: Vythica Floshin is a half-elf woman who resides by herself in a large stone house in Rythlon. A wizard of some manner, the Lost Shields encountered her when Murat wished to have his master's staff identified. She offered to do so in exchange for him helping her clean up her library; a task Murat to do rather poorly. Though she attempted to engage Murat in further pleasantries, the monk was quick to leave her house after she identified the staff, leaving her dejected at the rare chance for company.

Reanold-Duplechin.name: Reanold Duplechin
Reanold-Duplechin.quote: "Les gar make yourselves at home! Sit yourself down at my table. Have a seat, kick up your feet. I'll tell your future if I am able..."
description: Reanold Duplechin is a wandering merchant who arrived in Rythlon during the Lost Shields' altercations with Teliril Wasanathi.

He is of average height for a halfling, with a dark complexion and gaudy clothing. Around his neck is a silver chain with a bird skull looped through it. He drives an ostentatious wagon, on which he mounts various symbols of the occult, along with a staggering number of raven skulls. When asked where he is from, Reanold first responded that was 'not from around here', but after becoming more friendly with the Lost Shields, he revealed he was from a place he referred to as 'Maison du Corbeau'.

At first, the halfling simply saw the group as a way to earn some coin, selling them several minor magical items in exchange for some coin and a favor. However, following the group's return to Rythlon after killing the Lady of the Wood, Reanold intervened when Teliril cast Raise Dead on the hag's corpse. Using his Bardic talents, Reanold severed the magical tethers that were animating the corpse, allowing the Lost Shields a change to prove their innocence to Count Jeskin Sebroski.

After the completion of the trial and the death of Teliril, Reanold called upon Filibert to complete his bargain and sent the group off to look for his assistant, Leiana, who had run off with a magical figurine that Reanold uses to summon the horses that pull his wagon. The woman had last been seen at a place called 'the Bone Mill' north of the village. The only sign of the woman was scraps of a red cloak and drag marks inside the mill. With Leiana nowhere to be seen, the group returned with the figurine, completing Reanold's request.

Ithi-Ironjaw.name: Ithi Ironjaw
description: Ithi Ironjaw is a master runesmith. She is famous throughout Ulfwyst for her mastery of the art of Runesmithing. Most runesmiths are considered a master of their craft after learning to forge ten runes, at least one of which needs to be a Master Rune. Master Ironjaw is said to know at least 16 runes, including 5 Master Runes.
Ironjaw's reputation is well earned. Among her patrons include High King Bramdur Thundershod and Thane Gimmyl Wyrmbreaker, the lord of Felrast, for whom she has forged multiple runic items.

A Grand Reputation: While traveling from Auburn Castle, Filibert and Lirr spoke at length with Roland of Zelmar about this new bastard sword which he had forged in Felrast. Roland shared the story of his journey with the adventurers and explained why he sought out Master Ironjaw to forge him this new blade.
Roland spoke highly of the smith and her skills, stating to Filibert that if he wished to have a blade forged worthy of his ambitions, he could do no better than to seek out Master Ironjaw.

Vagnur-Mountainhall.name: Vagnur Mountainhall
description: Vagnur Mountainhall is one of the oldest Runesmiths in Ulfwyst. He manages an age-old workshop in the Dwarven Hold of Kazdan Ord, in the Jordonis Mountains. He rarely, if ever, leaves the hold. Speaking directly to the master is difficult, as his students and underlings will go to great lengths to keep prospective clients from speaking to their master unless they feel the request is worthy of Master Mountainhall's attention.

Temperamental and surly, the old runesmith spends most of his time passing on his craft to younger smiths he feels show promise in the art. He recently accepted Lirr Stonebreath as an apprentice, after she expressed interest in the art-form and passed a series of trials to prove she was worthy of the venerable dwarf's time.

Vyslos.name: Vyslos
description: Erlinder first encountered Vyslos when the Lost Shields returned to the Thornroot Thicket after the defeat of Teliril Wasanathi. Wishing to use this opportunity to try to understand his newfound abilities and connect with a place of natural power, Erlinder and his allies returned to the mysterious grove of megaliths, known as the Shrine of the Agrestal Cycle, in the middle of the forest. It was here, upon visiting for the second time, that he first encountered Vyslos, along with Cahina and Tekas Woadsinger.

Of the three druids that communed with Erlinder that night, Vyslos appeared to be the elder sage and the druid most in tune with the spell-casting aspect of his order. After discussing the nature of his power, and possible avenues in which to harness it, Erlinder chose to speak with Vyslos at length in order to further his understanding of the nature of druidic magics.
Vyslos informed Erlinder that the grove he oversees is located in the shadow of the Jordanis Mountains, in a place called the Shambling Grove.

Cahina.name: Cahina
description: Cahina informed Erlinder that the grove she oversees is located in the state of Cebrin, in southern Ulfwyst.

Tekas-Woadsinger.name: Tekas Woadsinger
description: Tekas Woadsinger is a druid and member of the Sylvan Conclave. Having embraced the shape shifting aspect of his druidic powers, Tekas appears as a huge, hulking humanoid-bear hybrid. In this form, he stand roughly 8 feet (2.25m) tall, with the face of a bear, dark gray fur, and large, powerful claws.
Tekas informed Erlinder that the grove he oversees is located in the Desolate Wastes, in central Ulfwyst.

Baqrin-Calosh.name: Baqrin Calosh
description: Lord Baqrin Calosh is a noble lord and ruler of the city-state of Venbrin. He has a long list of titles, which include the 7th Lord of Venbrin, Master of the Argentate & Protector of the Commercia Concordis. A middle aged human man, he has mid-length silvery, platinum blond hair and a goatee comprised of a thin mustache and chin-beard. Lord Baqrin does not seem to take his titles too seriously, and can be found wandering the city of Venbrin without escort. He is good natured, with a broad smile and a welcoming presence. He tends to dress in fine clothing, but carries himself more like a swashbuckling duelist than the noble lord of a city-state.

Lord Baqrin keeps his home at the Argentate, a walled palace in the north east of the city. He frequently leaves Venbrin aboard his personal flagship, the Shining Dawn, to patrol the waters around Venbrin for threats to his city and the merchant trade in the region.

True Form: Lord Calosh is the humaoid form of Zaldegarion, the adult bronze dragon, the true lord of Venbrin.

Zaldegarion.name: Zaldegarion
description: An adult bronze dragon who resides somewhere in the Barrier Coast.

False Form: Lord Calosh is the humaoid form of Zaldegarion, the adult bronze dragon, the true lord of Venbrin.

Yabtaeid.name: Yabtaeid
description: According to Akad the Magnificent during his brief interaction with the Lost Shields in the Molten Halls, Yabtaeid is a djinn who currently resides in the Free City of Venbrin.

Cazner-Yasir.name: Cazner Yasir
description: Cazner Yasir is the esteemed vizier of Vebrin. A half-elf with purple skin, dark hair and yellow eyes, Cazner cuts a striking figure in the Argentate with his flamboyant mannerisms and antics. He is a talkative man who enjoys entertainment, wine and well-prepared foods.

False Face: Cazner is the false form of Yabtaeid, the Djinn servant of

Franziska-Straken.name: Franziska Straken
Franziska-Straken.occupation: Archmage of Culture and Social Protection
Franziska-Straken.quote: "My, my… Teralion Elentiir, the esteemed archmage of Kilurus himself. What could possibly have been so remarkable as to drag the pureblooded advisor of Queen Inga from her frozen halls? It must be important. An arcanist of your stature wouldn't have come all the way to Sunheim with four bodyguards to sun himself on the beach."
description: @+Franziska Straken+@ is an Archmage of the Nost Ezel’nár and holds the title of @>Archmage of Culture and Social Protection<@. She is a tall, human woman in her mid forties with with sharp features, and graying, brown hair. She generally dresses in traditional attire of Azond, a region (and former nation-state) in northern Navolin.

Roles in the Lodge: As the @>Archmage of Culture and Social Protection<@, Franziska Straken is tasked by the Lodge of the Emerald Flame with the preservation of cultural integrity and maintaining of social order. More directly, it is her job to root out possible corrupting influences from Navolinian society. Fitting someone of her given role, she has an extensive knowledge of cults, deities and the planes. She is also responsible for the retrieval of elements of cultural importance for study, or items of great danger to civilization for containment at the Tower of Stantorr.

Known for her manipulative nature and die hard belief in the importance of her cause, Franziska is a decisive figure. Those who value social order and rigid structures view her as a hero who will go at great lengths to achieve her goals. Those who value personal freedom and unique cultural identities tend to view her as little more than a bully and a thief.
The Flaming Scalpel: Franziska and the arcanists who she oversees rarely take overt public action against dangerous elements of society they uncover. Often they will infiltrate occult organizations or attempt to manipulate known members of cabals into slowly destroying the organization from the inside naturally. When this does not work, or the situation proves too far along, the archmage and her allies will approach a situation with a scorched earth mentality. They feel it better to aggressively remove the cancer from society than to miss a portion and have it reappear later, possibly even more dangerous than before.
This gives the @>Archmage of Culture and Social Protection<@ a great deal of power, as what falls into the realm of "dangerous" is a matter of opinion.
